config.question: W.E.B. Du Bois challenged prevailing views about African Americans by suggesting which of the following?

choices.content: Higher rates of crime amongst African Americans resulted from environmental factors.
Higher rates of crime amongst African Americans resulted from genetic factors.
African Americans were less intelligent and thus unable to cope with the educational system.
African Americans had unhygienic habits, which led to greater health problems.

answer_3.response: In his book The Philadelphia Negro, Du Bois suggested that crime in the ward stemmed not from inborn degeneracy but from the environment in which blacks lived.
